heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 28 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.3°C), outside temperature (down 7.2°C), and inside temperature (down 2.3°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 2968 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 168 m) and light levels (up 3694 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 105.7m lower than yesterday, 167.9m lower than the past week, 33.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 821m and a high of 3400m, averaging 1689.2m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
